1 using System;
2 using System.Runtime.InteropServices;
3 using System.Windows;
4 using System.Windows.Interop;
5 using System.Windows.Media;

7 namespace Fasetto.Word

9  /// <summary>
10  /// The dock position of the window
11  /// </summary>
12  public enum WindowDockPosition
13  {
14  /// <summary>
15  /// Not docked
16  /// </summary>
17  Undocked,
18 
19  /// <summary>
20  /// Docked to the left of the screen
21  /// </summary>
22  Left,
23 
24  /// <summary>
25  /// Docked to the right of the screen
26  /// </summary>
27  Right,
28  }
29 
30  /// <summary>
31  /// Fixes the issue with Windows of Style <see cref="WindowStyle.None"/> covering the taskbar
32  /// </summary>
33  public class WindowResizer
34  {
35  #region Private Members
36 
37  /// <summary>
38  /// How close to the edge the window has to be to be detected as at the edge of the screen
39  /// </summary>
40  private const int EdgeTolerance = 2;
41 
42  /// <summary>
43  /// The last known dock position
44  /// </summary>
45  private WindowDockPosition mLastDock = WindowDockPosition.Undocked;
46 
47  /// <summary>
48  /// The last screen the window was on
49  /// </summary>
50  private IntPtr mLastScreen;
51 
52  /// <summary>
53  /// The last calculated available screen size
54  /// </summary>
55  private Rect mScreenSize = new Rect();
56 
57  /// <summary>
58  /// The transform matrix used to convert WPF sizes to screen pixels
59  /// </summary>
60  private Matrix mTransformToDevice;
61 
62  /// <summary>
63  /// The window to handle the resizing for
64  /// </summary>
65  private readonly Window _mWindow;
66 
67  #endregion Private Members
68 
69  #region Dll Imports
70 
71  [DllImport("user32.dll")]
72  [return: MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.Bool)]
73  private static extern bool GetCursorPos(out Point lpPoint);
74 
75  [DllImport("user32.dll")]
76  private static extern bool GetMonitorInfo(IntPtr hMonitor, MonitorInfo lpmi);
77 
78  [DllImport("user32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
79  private static extern IntPtr MonitorFromPoint(Point pt, MonitorOptions dwFlags);
80 
81  #endregion Dll Imports
82 
83 
84 
85  #region Public Events
86 
87  /// <summary>
88  /// Called when the window dock position changes
89  /// </summary>
90  public event Action<WindowDockPosition> WindowDockChanged = (dock) => { };
91 
92  #endregion Public Events
93 
94  #region Constructor
95 
96  /// <summary>
97  /// Default constructor
98  /// </summary>
99  /// <param name="window">The window to monitor and correctly maximize</param>
100  public WindowResizer(Window window)
101  {
102  // The Window Handle
103  _mWindow = window;
104 
105  // Create transform visual (for converting WPF size to pixel size)
106  GetTransform();
107 
108  // Listen out for source initialized to setup
109  _mWindow.SourceInitialized += Window_SourceInitialized;
110 
111  // Monitor for edge docking
112  _mWindow.SizeChanged += Window_SizeChanged;
113  }
114 
115  #endregion Constructor
116 
117  #region Initialize
118 
119  /// <summary>
120  /// Gets the transform object used to convert WPF sizes to screen pixels
121  /// </summary>
122  private void GetTransform()
123  {
124  // Get the visual source
125  var source = PresentationSource.FromVisual(_mWindow);
126 
127  // Reset the transform to default
128  mTransformToDevice = default(Matrix);
129 
130  // Otherwise, get the new transform object
131  if (source?.CompositionTarget != null) mTransformToDevice = source.CompositionTarget.TransformToDevice;
132  }
133 
134  /// <summary>
135  /// Initialize and hook into the windows message pump
136  /// </summary>
137  /// <param name="sender"></param>
138  /// <param name="e"></param>
139  private void Window_SourceInitialized(object sender, System.EventArgs e)
140  {
141  // Get the handle of this window
142  var handle = (new WindowInteropHelper(_mWindow)).Handle;
143  var handleSource = HwndSource.FromHwnd(handle);
144 
145  // Hook into it's Windows messages
146  handleSource?.AddHook(WindowProc);
147  }
148 
149  #endregion Initialize
150 
151  #region Edge Docking
152 
153  /// <summary>
154  /// Monitors for size changes and detects if the window has been docked (Aero snap) to an edge
155  /// </summary>
156  /// <param name="sender"></param>
157  /// <param name="e"></param>
158  private void Window_SizeChanged(object sender, SizeChangedEventArgs e)
159  {
160  // We cannot find positioning until the window transform has been established
161  if (mTransformToDevice == default(Matrix))
162  return;
163 
164  // Get the WPF size
165  var size = e.NewSize;
166 
167  // Get window rectangle
168  var top = _mWindow.Top;
169  var left = _mWindow.Left;
170  var bottom = top + size.Height;
171  var right = left + _mWindow.Width;
172 
173  // Get window position/size in device pixels
174  var windowTopLeft = mTransformToDevice.Transform(new System.Windows.Point(left, top));
175  var windowBottomRight = mTransformToDevice.Transform(new System.Windows.Point(right, bottom));
176 
177  // Check for edges docked
178  var edgedTop = windowTopLeft.Y <= (mScreenSize.Top + EdgeTolerance);
179  var edgedLeft = windowTopLeft.X <= (mScreenSize.Left + EdgeTolerance);
180  var edgedBottom = windowBottomRight.Y >= (mScreenSize.Bottom - EdgeTolerance);
181  var edgedRight = windowBottomRight.X >= (mScreenSize.Right - EdgeTolerance);
182 
183  // Get docked position
184  var dock = WindowDockPosition.Undocked;
185 
186  // Left docking
187  if (edgedTop && edgedBottom && edgedLeft)
188  dock = WindowDockPosition.Left;
189  else if (edgedTop && edgedBottom && edgedRight)
190  dock = WindowDockPosition.Right;
191  // None
192  else
193  return;
194  //dock = WindowDockPosition.Undocked;
195 
196  // If dock has changed
197  if (dock != mLastDock)
198  // Inform listeners
199  WindowDockChanged(dock);
200 
201  // Save last dock position
202  mLastDock = dock;
203  }
204 
205  #endregion Edge Docking
206 
207  #region Windows Proc
208 
209  /// <summary>
210  /// Listens out for all windows messages for this window
211  /// </summary>
212  /// <param name="hwnd"></param>
213  /// <param name="msg"></param>
214  /// <param name="wParam"></param>
215  /// <param name="lParam"></param>
216  /// <param name="handled"></param>
217  /// <returns></returns>
218  private IntPtr WindowProc(IntPtr hwnd, int msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, ref bool handled)
219  {
220  switch (msg)
221  {
222  // Handle the GetMinMaxInfo of the Window
223  case 0x0024:/* WM_GETMINMAXINFO */
224  WmGetMinMaxInfo(hwnd, lParam);
225  handled = true;
226  break;
227 
228  default:
229  break;
230  }
231 
232  return (IntPtr)0;
233  }
234 
235  #endregion Windows Proc
236 
237 
238 
239  #region Private Methods
240 
241  /// <summary>
242  /// Get the min/max window size for this window Correctly accounting for the taskbar size and position
243  /// </summary>
244  /// <param name="hwnd"></param>
245  /// <param name="lParam"></param>
246  private void WmGetMinMaxInfo(System.IntPtr hwnd, System.IntPtr lParam)
247  {
248  // Get the point position to determine what screen we are on
249  GetCursorPos(out var lMousePosition);
250 
251  // Get the primary monitor at cursor position 0,0
252  var lPrimaryScreen = MonitorFromPoint(new Point(0, 0), MonitorOptions.MonitorDefaultToPrimary);
253 
254  // Try and get the primary screen information
255  var lPrimaryScreenInfo = new MonitorInfo();
256  if (GetMonitorInfo(lPrimaryScreen, lPrimaryScreenInfo) == false)
257  return;
258 
259  // Now get the current screen
260  var lCurrentScreen = MonitorFromPoint(lMousePosition, MonitorOptions.MonitorDefaultToNearest);
261 
262  // If this has changed from the last one, update the transform
263  if (lCurrentScreen != mLastScreen || mTransformToDevice == default(Matrix))
264  GetTransform();
265 
266  // Store last know screen
267  mLastScreen = lCurrentScreen;
268 
269  // Get min/max structure to fill with information
270  var lMmi = (MinMaxInfo)Marshal.PtrToStructure(lParam, typeof(MinMaxInfo));
271 
272  // If it is the primary screen, use the rcWork variable
273  if (lPrimaryScreen.Equals(lCurrentScreen) == true)
274  {
275  lMmi.mMaxPosition.X = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcWork.mLeft;
276  lMmi.mMaxPosition.Y = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcWork.mTop;
277  lMmi.mMaxSize.X = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcWork.mRight - lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcWork.mLeft;
278  lMmi.mMaxSize.Y = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcWork.mBottom - lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcWork.mTop;
279  }
280  // Otherwise it's the rcMonitor values
281  else
282  {
283  lMmi.mMaxPosition.X = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcMonitor.mLeft;
284  lMmi.mMaxPosition.Y = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcMonitor.mTop;
285  lMmi.mMaxSize.X = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcMonitor.mRight - lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcMonitor.mLeft;
286  lMmi.mMaxSize.Y = lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcMonitor.mBottom - lPrimaryScreenInfo.mRcMonitor.mTop;
287  }
288 
289  // Set min size
290  var minSize = mTransformToDevice.Transform(new System.Windows.Point(_mWindow.MinWidth, _mWindow.MinHeight));
291 
292  lMmi.mMinTrackSize.X = (int)minSize.X;
293  lMmi.mMinTrackSize.Y = (int)minSize.Y;
294 
295  // Store new size
296  mScreenSize = new Rect(lMmi.mMaxPosition.X, lMmi.mMaxPosition.Y, lMmi.mMaxSize.X, lMmi.mMaxSize.Y);
297 
298  // Now we have the max size, allow the host to tweak as needed
299  Marshal.StructureToPtr(lMmi, lParam, true);
300  }
301 
302  #endregion Private Methods
303  }
304 
305  #region Dll Helper Structures
306 
307  /// <inheritdoc/>
308  internal enum MonitorOptions : uint
309  {
310  MonitorDefaultToNull = 0x00000000,
311  MonitorDefaultToPrimary = 0x00000001,
312  MonitorDefaultToNearest = 0x00000002
313  }
314 
315  /// <summary>
316  /// Information about maximum and minimum window sizes
317  /// </summary>
318  [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)]
319  public struct MinMaxInfo : IEquatable<MinMaxInfo>
320  {

354  }
355  };

357  /// <summary>
358  /// A point refered to as Point.X and Point.Y on the screen (or anywhere else)
359  /// </summary>
360  [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)]
361  public struct Point : IEquatable<Point>

368  /// <summary>
369  /// y coordinate of point.
370  /// </summary>

372

374  /// Construct a point of coordinates (x,y).
375  /// </summary>
376  public Point(int x, int y)
377  {
378  X = x;
379  Y = y;
380  }

393  /// <inheritdoc/>
394  [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)]
395  public struct Rectangle : IEquatable<Rectangle>
396  {
397  /// <summary>
398  /// Integer values for a rectangles left, top, right and bottom position (in effect its size)
399  /// </summary>
400  public int mLeft, mTop, mRight, mBottom;
401 
402  /// <summary>
403  /// The <see cref="Rectangle"/> constructor
404  /// </summary>
405  /// <param name="left"></param>
406  /// <param name="top"></param>
407  /// <param name="right"></param>
408  /// <param name="bottom"></param>
409  public Rectangle(int left, int top, int right, int bottom)
410  {
411  mLeft = left;
412  mTop = top;
413  mRight = right;
414  mBottom = bottom;
415  }
416 
417  /// <summary>
418  ///
419  /// </summary>
420  /// <param name="other"></param>
421  /// <returns></returns>
422  public bool Equals(Rectangle other)
423  {
424  return false;
425  }
426  }

428  /// <summary>
429  /// Monitor info such as its total size, available work area and any flags
430  /// </summary>
431  [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential, CharSet = CharSet.Auto)]
432  public class MonitorInfo
433  {
434  /// <summary>
435  /// The size of the <see cref="MonitorInfo"/>
436  /// </summary>
437  public int mCbSize = Marshal.SizeOf(typeof(MonitorInfo));
438 
439  /// <summary>
440  /// The total size of the monitor rectangle
441  /// </summary>
442  public Rectangle mRcMonitor = new Rectangle();
443 
444  /// <summary>
445  /// The actual available are on the monitor
446  /// </summary>
447  public Rectangle mRcWork = new Rectangle();
448 
449  /// <summary>
450  /// Any Monitor info flags
451  /// </summary>
452  public int mDwFlags = 0;
453  }
